Articles.Content:
Short movie made in short amount of time to replicate extreme docking scene from Interstellar.

Cheers
How do you put a camera inside your docking port?
Hey, well done! Personally, I love the docking scene...so intense!
@cicatrix - RasterPropMonitor give you that in every dock.

Awesome job . That was an intense movie scene, and a matching remake!

Edited December 10, 2014 by Avera9eJoe

nice!

best scene and best music of a awesome movie!
Nice job man. Do you get any clipping issues when you have the camera in the docking port?

Cool, although the Endurance in the movie was spinning at some 20RPM where your's is an easy peasy 5-6RPM.

Also, why is the soundtrack so warped? Completely ruined it for me in the audio department. Should've stuck with the original.
@SpaceXray - If I stuck with the original I would be striked by YT copyright system.

I hate to ruin the mood by nitpicking but why is the docking port not spinning on the monitor inside the cockpit while the Endurance IS spinning (relative to the Ranger) on external view? It should either spin on both views or be stationary on both.

Edited December 10, 2014 by Tex_NL
Corrected some spelling.

I hate to ruin the mood by nitpicking but why is the docking port not spinning on the monitor inside the cockpit while the Endurance IS spinning (relative to the Ranger) on external view? It should either spin on both views or be stationary on both.

Yeah that bothered me too.

I tried this right after seeing the movie. It was also really cool because I actually did a docking similar to that in KSP only a few weeks prior to seeing the film.

Is Interstellar still in theaters? Imax theaters? If not, that's the problem with these movies. Gravity too. You get only one chance to see it in the way it was meant for, then all you get is a crappy home TV version on netflix or a rented DVD. :/
